poses.name: Sun Salutation
poses.description: A complete sequence that warms up the entire body and connects breath with movement. According to David Frawley, this practice is excellent for stimulating the digestive fire (Agni) and removing toxins (Ama) from the body.
therapeuticUses: Stimulates Agni (digestive fire) - beneficial for Kapha imbalance
Improves circulation and removes Ama (toxins)
Balances all three doshas when practiced mindfully
Enhances Prana (vital energy) flow throughout the body
Strengthens the musculoskeletal system
Improves respiratory function

doshaSpecific.vata: Practice slowly with grounding awareness, focus on steady breathing and gentle movements
doshaSpecific.pitta: Practice in cool environment, avoid over-exertion, maintain calm breathing
doshaSpecific.kapha: Practice vigorously to stimulate metabolism and energy, focus on dynamic movement

poses.name: Child's Pose
benefits: Gentle stretch for hips and thighs
poses.description: A gentle resting pose that promotes introspection and calms the nervous system. Excellent for Vata and Pitta types who need grounding and cooling.
therapeuticUses: Calms Vata dosha - reduces anxiety and nervous tension
Cools Pitta dosha - reduces heat and inflammation
Promotes introspection and mental clarity
Relieves lower back tension and stress

doshaSpecific.vata: Excellent for grounding and calming, practice with deep breathing
doshaSpecific.pitta: Perfect for cooling and reducing heat, maintain for longer periods
doshaSpecific.kapha: Use as a transition pose, avoid staying too long to prevent lethargy

poses.name: Cobra Pose
poses.description: A gentle backbend that strengthens the spine and opens the chest. Excellent for Kapha types who need stimulation and Vata types who need gentle strengthening.
therapeuticUses: Stimulates Kapha dosha - energizes and awakens
Strengthens Vata dosha - builds stability and confidence
Opens the chest and improves respiratory function
Stimulates digestive organs and Agni

doshaSpecific.vata: Practice gently with focus on stability and grounding
doshaSpecific.kapha: Practice vigorously to stimulate energy and metabolism

poses.name: Plow Pose
poses.description: An inversion that calms the nervous system and stimulates the thyroid gland. Excellent for Pitta types who need cooling and Kapha types who need stimulation.
therapeuticUses: Cools Pitta dosha - reduces heat and inflammation
Stimulates Kapha dosha - energizes and awakens
Calms the nervous system and reduces stress
Stimulates thyroid function and metabolism

doshaSpecific.vata: Practice with support, avoid if feeling unstable
doshaSpecific.pitta: Excellent for cooling and calming, maintain longer
doshaSpecific.kapha: Good for stimulation, practice with energy

poses.name: Seated Forward Bend
poses.description: A calming forward bend that promotes introspection and stretches the back. Excellent for Pitta and Vata types who need cooling and calming.
therapeuticUses: Cools Pitta dosha - reduces heat and inflammation
Calms Vata dosha - promotes grounding and stability
Improves digestion and stimulates abdominal organs
Promotes introspection and mental clarity

doshaSpecific.vata: Practice gently with focus on breathing and relaxation
doshaSpecific.pitta: Excellent for cooling, maintain longer periods
doshaSpecific.kapha: Practice with energy to avoid lethargy

poses.name: Corpse Pose
poses.description: The ultimate relaxation pose that allows the body to integrate the benefits of yoga practice. Essential for all dosha types.
therapeuticUses: Balances all doshas through deep relaxation
Reduces stress and promotes healing
Calms the nervous system and improves sleep
Allows integration of yoga practice benefits

doshaSpecific.vata: Essential for grounding and calming, practice longer
doshaSpecific.pitta: Excellent for cooling and reducing heat
doshaSpecific.kapha: Important for integration, avoid falling asleep

poses.name: Bridge Pose
poses.description: A gentle backbend that strengthens the back and opens the chest. Excellent for Kapha types who need stimulation and Vata types who need gentle strengthening.
therapeuticUses: Stimulates Kapha dosha - energizes and awakens
Strengthens Vata dosha - builds stability
Opens the chest and improves respiratory function
Stimulates thyroid function and metabolism

doshaSpecific.vata: Practice gently with focus on stability

poses.name: Triangle Pose
poses.description: A standing pose that improves balance and stability while opening the body. Beneficial for all dosha types.
therapeuticUses: Balances all doshas through grounding and stability
Improves balance and coordination
Strengthens the musculoskeletal system
Opens the chest and improves respiratory function

poses.name: Warrior II
poses.description: A powerful standing pose that builds strength and confidence. Excellent for Kapha types who need stimulation and Vata types who need grounding.
therapeuticUses: Stimulates Kapha dosha - energizes and awakens
Strengthens Vata dosha - builds confidence and stability
Improves focus and concentration
Builds physical and mental strength

doshaSpecific.vata: Excellent for grounding and building confidence

poses.name: Tree Pose
poses.description: A balancing pose that improves focus and promotes grounding. Excellent for Vata and Pitta types who need stability and calm.
therapeuticUses: Grounds Vata dosha - improves stability and focus
Calms Pitta dosha - reduces heat and promotes concentration
Improves balance and coordination
Promotes mental clarity and focus

poses.name: Lotus Pose
poses.description: A classic seated pose that promotes meditation and spiritual practice. Excellent for all dosha types when practiced mindfully.
therapeuticUses: Balances all doshas through meditation
Promotes mental clarity and focus
Strengthens the spine and improves posture
Opens the hips and improves flexibility

poses.name: Headstand
poses.description: The king of all asanas, headstand improves circulation and stimulates the brain. Excellent for Kapha and Pitta types when practiced safely.
therapeuticUses: Stimulates Kapha dosha - energizes and awakens
Cools Pitta dosha - reduces heat and inflammation
Improves circulation to the brain
Strengthens the upper body

doshaSpecific.vata: Practice with extreme caution, avoid if unstable
doshaSpecific.kapha: Excellent for stimulation, practice with energy

sequences.name: Morning Energizing Sequence
sequences.description: A sequence designed to energize and awaken the body in the morning, perfect for Kapha types. Based on David Frawley's recommendations for stimulating Agni and removing Ama.

sequences.name: Evening Calming Sequence
sequences.description: A gentle sequence designed to calm the mind and prepare for rest, perfect for Vata and Pitta types. Based on David Frawley's recommendations for calming the nervous system.

sequences.name: Digestive Health Sequence
sequences.description: A sequence designed to support healthy digestion and stimulate Agni. Based on David Frawley's recommendations for digestive health.

sequences.name: Stress Relief Sequence
sequences.description: A sequence designed to reduce stress and promote mental clarity. Based on David Frawley's recommendations for mental health.

sequences.name: Energy and Vitality Sequence
sequences.description: A sequence designed to increase energy and vitality. Based on David Frawley's recommendations for energizing practices.

pranayama.name: Alternate Nostril Breathing
pranayama.description: A balancing breathing technique that purifies the energy channels and balances the left and right hemispheres of the brain. According to David Frawley, this practice is essential for balancing all doshas and calming the mind.
benefits: Balances left and right brain hemispheres

pranayama.name: Skull Shining Breath
pranayama.description: An energizing breathing technique that cleanses the skull and stimulates the brain. Excellent for Kapha types who need stimulation and Vata types who need energizing.

pranayama.name: Victorious Breath
pranayama.description: A calming breathing technique that creates a gentle sound in the throat. Perfect for Vata and Pitta types who need calming and grounding.

pranayama.name: Bellows Breath
pranayama.description: A powerful breathing technique that increases energy and stimulates the nervous system. Excellent for Kapha types who need energizing.

pranayama.name: Cooling Breath
pranayama.description: A cooling breathing technique that reduces heat and calms Pitta dosha. Perfect for Pitta types who need cooling.

pranayama.name: Humming Bee Breath
pranayama.description: A calming breathing technique that creates a humming sound like a bee. Excellent for Vata and Pitta types who need calming.

categories.name: Ayurvedic Yoga
categories.description: Yoga poses and sequences based on Ayurvedic principles

categories.name: Therapeutic Sequences
categories.description: Yoga sequences for specific health benefits
